result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 5, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 3:10 PM 
Defendant Justen C Benson in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Justen C Benson.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court reviews the court record. 

Atty Hoff requests a possible plea date be scheduled. 
--no objection from ADA Witt

recess: 3:12pm 
NEXT: Plea & Sentencing 1/5/23 at 3:00pm (if no resolution, set for trial)
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ml] Case called at 1:35PM
Defendant Justen C Benson in court with Attorney Zachary Hoff. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Att Hoff states that negotiations have concluded, and that the Defense is considering the State's offer. Att Hoff further states that it will inform the parties as to the expected direction of the case at the time of the next hearing. ADA Shock requests that a Status be scheduled.

recess 1:38PM

NEXT: Status Conference on 10/25 at 3:00PM with in person appearances

[ma] Case called at 2:00 PM 
Defendant Justen C Benson in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Justen C Benson.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews the court record. 

On Defendant's Motion to Amend Bond: 
--DA Hall verifies receipt of motion 
--Statement made by JCHS Representative, Gerth 

By agreement of the Parties, the Court modifies bond to bifurcate the no contact orders. 
Conditions are to be, No Contact with Victim 1 and No Contact with minor child, unless in compliance with rules, recommendations, and conditions of Jefferson County Human Services regarding the child. 

recess: 2:07pm
Set for hearing. Parties may also address this by stip at their PTC on 8/24
Motion hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail

Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Amended

[ma] Case called at 1:27 PM 
Defendant Justen C Benson in court. Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Justen C Benson.  Attorney Melanie Flint in court for State of Wisconsin.  

The Court reviews the court record. 

Mr. Benson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Atty Flint verifies victim rights compliance. 

Atty Hoff moves for amendment of bond
Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court amends bond to allow contact with minor child so long as third party is present.

recess: 1:40pm  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/24/22 at 11:40am   (2) Status Conference on 9/30/22 at 1:30pm

[ma] Case called at 1:33 PM 
Defendant Justen C Benson in court.  Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the court record. 

Mr. Benson indicates that he did not apply for public defender representation, because he intends to hire private counsel. 

Mr. Benson requests a bond modification. 

Atty Flint verifies victim rights compliance. 

The Court consults with person in gallery, learns it is grandmother of victim.

ADDRESS INFO for Justen C Benson
Current: 806 S Center Ave Apt #3, Jefferson, WI 53549   (Effective: 06-08-2022)
Prior: 806 S Center Ave, Jefferson, WI 53549

**All Appearances via Zoom** case called 01:34 PM Defendant Justen C Bensonappears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Attorney Bartek (PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Law Intern Shelton appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge(*s) and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1 or minor child that they share in common

The Court tolls time limits
Defendant provides apt #3 to address
recess 1:40 pm.
